[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Default::default()] [thread_rng predictability] Can calling thread_rng() in default() produce deterministic parameters in certain environments (tests, deterministic builds), creating identical parameters across all validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Default::default()] [Production misuse] Is there sufficient protection against accidentally using Default::default() test parameters in production validator configurations, which would critically weaken security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares()] [Same RNG weakness] Does using thread_rng() consistently mean different validator nodes could generate incompatible PublicParameters if they don't coordinate on a common source? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares()] [n=0 handling] If with_max_num_shares(0) is called, does this propagate to new() causing invalid parameter generation that breaks the DKG protocol? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares()] [Large n attack] Can an attacker call with_max_num_shares(usize::MAX) causing integer overflow in new()'s max_num_chunks_padded calculation and generating corrupt parameters? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares_for_generate()] [Optimization vulnerability] Does the 'optimization' of creating parameters with max_num_shares=1 but using them with larger n in generate() cause range proof verification failures or allow invalid proofs to pass? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: with_max_num_shares_for_generate()] [Comment vs implementation mismatch] The comment says 'make the rest as small as possible' but still uses DEFAULT_ELL_FOR_TESTING - can this create parameters that are too weak for actual generation operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Pairing bilinearity attack] Can an attacker exploit the bilinear pairing structure (E::G1, E::G2) to create relationships between encrypted shares and commitments that leak information about secrets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Subgroup confinement] Are all group elements (G from pp_elgamal, G_2, range proof generators) properly confined to the prime-order subgroup, or can small subgroup attacks compromise discrete log hardness? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Constant: DST] [Domain separation weakness] Does the DST constant properly separate hash-to-curve operations from other protocol components, or can hash collisions across different contexts be exploited? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: compute_powers_of_radix()] [Radix security] Is the radix (2^ell) cryptographically appropriate, or can small radix values leak information through side channels or make brute force attacks feasible? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Struct: PublicParameters] [Quantum resistance] Since this uses pairing-based cryptography (vulnerable to quantum attacks), are there any protections or migration paths when quantum computers become practical? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Hash collision attack] Can an attacker find curve points that hash to the same Vec<u8> key in the HashMap, causing dlog lookups to return incorrect exponents and breaking secret reconstruction? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Table poisoning] If multiple threads access the table HashMap concurrently without synchronization, can race conditions cause incorrect lookups or panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Incomplete table] Does the dlog table contain all necessary values for the expected range [0, 2^ell), or can out-of-range chunk values cause lookup failures during decryption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Memory DOS] Can an attacker trigger table rebuilding repeatedly to exhaust memory, especially with large ell values creating multi-gigabyte HashMaps? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: table] [Serialization vulnerability] Since the table is not serialized, does cross-node parameter sharing create inconsistencies if different nodes have different table contents due to bugs or attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: pk_range_proof] [Prover key compromise] If the dekart_univariate_v2::ProverKey is leaked or predictable, can an attacker forge range proofs for invalid chunk values, bypassing secret validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: pk_range_proof] [max_num_chunks_padded manipulation] Can an attacker create parameters where max_num_chunks_padded doesn't match the actual number of chunks in transcripts, causing range proof verification to incorrectly accept or reject proofs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: pk_range_proof] [ell mismatch attack] If pk_range_proof is set up with ell=16 but later used with ell=32, can this create a range proof that accepts 32-bit chunks when it should only accept 16-bit, allowing invalid secrets? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: pk_range_proof] [Setup randomness reuse] If the same RNG state is used across multiple dekart_univariate_v2::Proof::setup() calls, can related prover keys leak information enabling proof forgery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Verifier key missing] Does new() only return the ProverKey without generating/validating the corresponding VerifierKey, potentially causing verification to fail if keys are mismatched? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Generic: E: Pairing] [Curve choice vulnerability] Can an attacker instantiate PublicParameters with a weak or backdoored pairing-friendly curve (e.g., using a non-standard E) that has known discrete log vulnerabilities? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Generic: E: Pairing] [G1/G2 group mismatch] If an attacker provides parameters where G (E::G1) and G_2 (E::G2) are from incompatible groups or curves, can pairing operations fail or produce exploitable results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Field: G_2] [G2 cofactor attack] Is G_2 checked to be in the prime-order subgroup of E::G2, or can cofactor attacks using points from the full group compromise commitment security? (Critical)
